column1: #Text=[0079] Melt pressed films were punched with a 5 mm diameter and weighed.
#Text=The films were then immersed in a vial containing 1 mL deionized water.
#Text=The films were agitated at a rate of 5 rpm using a GyroTwister (Labnet International Inc.) over a period of four weeks.
#Text=At the end of each week, the films were dried under vacuum at 40.degree.
#Text=The weight difference was plotted over time.
#Text=This experiment was carried out in triplicate for each time period.
#Text=Preparation of Aqueous Dispersions/Nanoparticles from Butyl Rubber-PEO Graft Copolymers
#Text=[0080] A 10 mg/mL solution of the graft copolymer was prepared in filtered THF.
#Text=To this solution, filtered deionized water was added rapidly via syringe to provide solutions containing either 100%, 70%, 50%, or 30% THF.
#Text=The resulting solutions were then dialyzed overnight against water using a regenerated cellulose membrane (Spectra/Por) with a molecular weight cut-off of 12000-14000 g/mol.
#Text=Dynamic light scattering was performed on ZetaSizer Nano instrument from Malvern Instruments.
#Text=[0081] A drop of the nanoparticie suspension (.about.3 mg/mL) was transferred via pipette to a carbon formvar grid and was left for 1 minute.
#Text=The grid was stained with the vapour of OsO.sub.4 in a sealed container, for 2 hours.
#Text=Imaging was performed using a Phillips CM10 microscope operating at 80 kV with a 40 .mu.m aperture.
